page.title: 03Communications
page.content: There is a sub-post office in Munder- field. The present post mistress has been in this position for about twelve months. There is one postal delivery a day, the postman arriving l0 o'clock to l0.30 a.m.; there is also one collection. Many of the local pensioners collect their weekly allowance from here, as this is more convenient than having to travel to Bromyard or Ledbury where they would also have to wait in a queue. There are two post boxes in the area, and one public telephone kiosk. Most people now have a telephone in their own homes, this is now almost a necessity in the country.
